result.execSummary:
The defendant Katherine J Downer Jossi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court will not permit early termination of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any 
treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with Jasmine G. or Terry B.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Katherine J Downer Jossi in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 30 days jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation - Court will not permit early termination of Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No contact with Jasmine G. or Terry B..  
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service as a condition of Probation

Expunction addressed.
Court denies request for expunction.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-14-2015 02:00 pm
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 7/1/15 decision.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Katherine J Downer Jossi in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a jury status/jury trial date. Court grants request. Form given to Attorney regarding motions, jury instructions and witnesses.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Katherine J Downer Jossi in court with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for court to give decision on the defense's motion. Court denied the Motion to Suppress.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion opposing the Defendant's Motion to Suppress filed by the State.

Defendant's brief in support to motion to suppress with attached Affidavit of Fax filed by Attorney Buttery.
Hearing on July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Katherine J Downer Jossi in court with attorney Adam Schleis and Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer Adam Olson sworn and questioned on direct by Atty. Bennewitz.  Cross by Atty. Williams Buttery.  Redirect by Atty. Bennewitz.  Questions by the Court.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Argument by Atty. Bennewitz and Atty. Williams Buttery.  
Atty. Aprhamian requests briefing on this matter.  Defense to discuss whether there is a good faith exception giving the timing  with the Rodriguez decision.  Defense's brief due 6-12-15  State's brief is due 6-19-15.  Court will  either issue a written decision or give the decision at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

filed by Attorney Padurean.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Katherine J Downer Jossi in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY THE COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
